idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: The dataset depicts the authoritative locations of the most commonly known Department of Defense (DoD) sites, installations, ranges, and training areas in the United States and Territories. These sites encompass land which is federally owned or otherwise managed. This dataset was created from source data provided by the four Military Service Component headquarters and was compiled by the Defense Installation Spatial Data Infrastructure (DISDI) Program within the Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of Defense for Installations and Environment, Business Enterprise Integration Directorate. Sites were selected from the 2010 Base Structure Report (BSR), a summary of the DoD Real Property Inventory. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. For inventory purposes, installations are comprised of sites, where a site is defined as a specific geographic location of federally owned or managed land and is assigned to military installation. DoD installations are commonly referred to as a base, camp, post, station, yard, center, homeport facility for any ship, or other activity under the jurisdiction, custody, control of the DoD.
descript.purpose: This geospatial dataset contains authoritative point locations of Department of Defense sites, commonly referred to as installations, ranges, and training areas. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. Additionally, some sites were not included because geospatial data were not available, or it is a leased site.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of Defense for Installations and Environment, Business Enterprise Integration Directorate

idinfo.accconst: Preferred use citation: "This data was accessed by the user at geodata.gov. Although these data have been provided by the DoD Components, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on any other system, in derived products or data alterations, nor shall the act of distribution constitute and such warranty."
idinfo.useconst:
While every attempt has been made to provide the best available data quality, this data set is intended for use at mapping scales between 1:250,000 and 1:3,000,000.
Although these data have been provided by each Service Component, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed in the use of these data.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The dataset depicts the authoritative locations of the most commonly known Department of Defense (DoD) sites, installations, ranges, and training areas in the United States and Territories. These sites encompass land which is federally owned or otherwise managed. This dataset was created from source data provided by the four Military Service Component headquarters and was compiled by the Defense Installation Spatial Data Infrastructure (DISDI) Program within the Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of Defense for Installations and Environment, Business Enterprise Integration Directorate. Sites were selected from the 2010 Base Structure Report (BSR), a summary of the DoD Real Property Inventory. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. For inventory purposes, installations are comprised of sites, where a site is defined as a specific geographic location of federally owned or managed land and is assigned to military installation. DoD installations are commonly referred to as a base, camp, post, station, yard, center, homeport facility for any ship, or other activity under the jurisdiction, custody, control of the DoD.

procstep.procdesc:
This geospatial dataset contains authoritative point locations of Department of Defense sites, commonly referred to as installations, ranges, and training areas. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. Additionally, some sites were not included because geospatial data were not available, or it is a leased site.
Final selection and approval of sites were coordinated and approved by each of the Army, Air Force, Navy and Marine Corps headquarters programs for installation geospatial information and services (IGI&S). Each IGI&S program coordinated review and approval with their respective real property officers to the greatest practical extent.
Installation data provided by the Service IGI&S programs depict the general location of installations, sites, ranges, and other areas managed by DoD as reported in the Federal Real Property Profile. Point locations were provided by an authoritative source or derived from notional (non-surveyed) site boundaries and represent approximate locations. Points are placed either at the relative center of each site or near the center of the most commonly used portion of the site. Users may note positional inaccuracies in the point placement when zooming to specific site locations, particularly those with no boundaries.
The initial raw data set was aggregated from several key DoD site location data sources by the DISDI Program and provided to each Service component for review. The Service IGI&S Programs coordinated with support teams to review the data, confirm site/location information, and provide corrections. All feedback received from the Services was incorporated into the final database.
This dataset represents the baseline for georeferenced site locations in the Base Structure Report. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities. The Department has an ongoing effort to refine site location data and intends to incorporate improvements in future annual releases.

dataqual.complete: This dataset represents the baseline for georeferenced site locations in the Base Structure Report. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities. The Department has an ongoing effort to refine site location data and intends to incorporate improvements in future annual releases.

dataLineage.statement:
This geospatial dataset contains authoritative point locations of Department of Defense sites, commonly referred to as installations, ranges, and training areas. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. Additionally, some sites were not included because geospatial data were not available, or it is a leased site. Final selection and approval of sites were coordinated and approved by each of the Army, Air Force, Navy and Marine Corps headquarters programs for installation geospatial information and services (IGI&S). Each IGI&S program coordinated review and approval with their respective real property officers to the greatest practical extent.
Installation data provided by the Service IGI&S programs depict the general location of installations, sites, ranges, and other areas managed by DoD as reported in the Federal Real Property Profile. Point locations were provided by an authoritative source or derived from notional (non-surveyed) site boundaries and represent approximate locations. Points are placed either at the relative center of each site or near the center of the most commonly used portion of the site. Users may note positional inaccuracies in the point placement when zooming to specific site locations, particularly those with no boundaries.
The initial raw data set was aggregated from several key DoD site location data sources by the DISDI Program and provided to each Service component for review. The Service IGI&S Programs coordinated with support teams to review the data, confirm site/location information, and provide corrections. All feedback received from the Services was incorporated into the final database.
This dataset represents the baseline for georeferenced site locations in the Base Structure Report. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities. The Department has an ongoing effort to refine site location data and intends to incorporate improvements in future annual releases.
